title: Physical and Elementary Chemistry Characterization of Particles PM2.5 through Scanning Electron Microscopy equipped with X-ray Scattering
content: The results obtained from PM2.5 Particles at the sampling site in the downtown of the City of Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico are presented. 36 samples were obtained and analyzed using a JEOL model JSM 5800-LV scanning electron microscope coupled to an energy dispersive X-ray system (EDS), EDAX model DX prime. The elements found in the particle filters have been C, Na, Mg, Al, Si, Ca, K, O and Ba; whose morphology and chemical composition of the particles indicate an important contribution of the natural elements located in the area, such as those of anthropogenic origin, such as Pb and S, which are of interest from the environmental point of view, as well as public health.
